019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import com.google.gson.JsonArray;
022import com.google.gson.JsonObject;
023import com.google.gson.reflect.TypeToken;
024import io.kubernetes.client.Discovery.APIResource;
025import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient;
026import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
027import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.apis.CustomObjectsApi;
028import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1APIResource;
029import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1Namespace;
030import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ObjectMeta;
031import io.kubernetes.client.util.Config;
032import io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch;
033import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.dynamic.DynamicKubernetesApi;
034import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.ListOptions;
035import java.io.IOException;
036import java.util.HashSet;
037import java.util.LinkedList;
038import java.util.List;
039import java.util.Set;
040import java.util.logging.Level;
041import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
042import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8s;
043import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sClient;
044import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicModel;
045import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicStub;
046import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1PodStub;
047import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.APP_NAME;
048import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM;
049import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_NAME;
050import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmChannel;
051import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
052import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util.GsonPtr;
053import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
054
055/**
056 * Watches for changes of VM definitions.
057 */
058@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis", "PMD.ExcessiveImports" })
059public class VmWatcher extends AbstractWatcher {
060
061    private K8sClient client;
062    private APIResource context;
063
064    /**
065     * Instantiates a new VM definition watcher.
066     *
067     * @param componentChannel the component channel
068     */
069    public VmWatcher(Channel componentChannel) {
070        super(componentChannel);
071    }
072
073    @Override
074    protected void startWatching() throws IOException, ApiException {
075        // Get all our API versions
076        client = new K8sClient();
077        var ctx = K8s.context(client, VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM);
078        if (ctx.isEmpty()) {
079            logger.severe(() -> "Cannot get CRD context.");
080            return;
081        }
082        context = ctx.get();
083
084        // Remove left overs
085        var coa = new CustomObjectsApi(client);
086        purge(coa, context.getVersions());
087
088        // Start a watcher thread for each existing CRD version.
089        // The watcher will send us an "ADDED" for each existing VM.
090        for (var version : context.getVersions()) {
091            coa.getAPIResources(VM_OP_GROUP, version)
092                .getResources().stream()
093                .filter(r -> VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(r.getKind()))
094                .findFirst()
095                .ifPresent(crd -> watchVmDefs(crd, version));
096        }
097    }
098
099    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CognitiveComplexity")
100    private void purge(CustomObjectsApi coa, List<String> vmOpApiVersions)
101            throws ApiException {
102        // Get existing CRs (VMs)
103        Set<String> known = new HashSet<>();
104        for (var version : vmOpApiVersions) {
105            // Get all known CR instances.
106            coa.getAPIResources(VM_OP_GROUP, version)
107                .getResources().stream()
108                .filter(r -> VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(r.getKind()))
109                .findFirst()
110                .ifPresent(crd -> known.addAll(getKnown(client, crd, version)));
111        }
112
113        ListOptions opts = new ListOptions();
114        opts.setLabelSelector(
115            "app.kubernetes.io/managed-by=" + VM_OP_NAME + ","
116                + "app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME);
117        for (String resource : List.of("apps/v1/statefulsets",
118            "v1/configmaps", "v1/secrets")) {
119            @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
120                "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
121            var resParts = new LinkedList<>(List.of(resource.split("/")));
122            var group = resParts.size() == 3 ? resParts.poll() : "";
123            var version = resParts.poll();
124            var plural = resParts.poll();
125            // Get resources, selected by label
126            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
127            var api = new DynamicKubernetesApi(group, version, plural, client);
128            var listObj = api.list(namespaceToWatch(), opts).getObject();
129            if (listObj == null) {
130                continue;
131            }
132            for (var obj : listObj.getItems()) {
133                String instance = obj.getMetadata().getLabels()
134                    .get("app.kubernetes.io/instance");
135                if (!known.contains(instance)) {
136                    var resName = obj.getMetadata().getName();
137                    var result = api.delete(namespaceToWatch(), resName);
138                    if (!result.isSuccess()) {
139                        logger.warning(() -> "Cannot cleanup resource \""
140                            + resName + "\": " + result.toString());
141                    }
142                }
143            }
144        }
145    }
146
147    private Set<String> getKnown(ApiClient client, V1APIResource crd,
148            String version) {
149        Set<String> result = new HashSet<>();
150        var api = new DynamicKubernetesApi(VM_OP_GROUP, version,
151            crd.getName(), client);
152        for (var item : api.list(namespaceToWatch()).getObject().getItems()) {
153            if (!VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(item.getKind())) {
154                continue;
155            }
156            result.add(item.getMetadata().getName());
157        }
158        return result;
159    }
160
161    private void watchVmDefs(V1APIResource crd, String version) {
162        try {
163            var client = Config.defaultClient();
164            var coa = new CustomObjectsApi(client);
165            var call = coa.listNamespacedCustomObjectCall(VM_OP_GROUP,
166                version, namespaceToWatch(), crd.getName(), null, false,
167                null, null, null, null, null, null, null, true, null);
168            startWatcher(crd, call,
169                new TypeToken<Watch.Response<V1Namespace>>() {
170                }.getType(), this::handleVmDefinitionChange);
171        } catch (IOException | ApiException e) {
172            logger.log(Level.SEVERE, e, () -> "Problem watching \""
173                + crd.getName() + "\": " + e.getMessage());
174        }
175    }
176
177    private void handleVmDefinitionChange(V1APIResource vmsCrd,
178            Watch.Response<V1Namespace> vmDefRef) {
179        V1ObjectMeta metadata = vmDefRef.object.getMetadata();
180        VmChannel channel = channel(metadata.getName());
181        if (channel == null) {
182            return;
183        }
184
185        // Get full definition and associate with channel as backup
186        var vmStub = K8sDynamicStub.get(channel.client(),
187            context,
188            metadata.getNamespace(), metadata.getName());
189        try {
190            vmStub.model().ifPresent(vmDef -> {
191                addDynamicData(channel.client(), vmDef);
192                channel.setVmDefinition(vmDef);
193
194                // Create and fire event
195                channel.pipeline().fire(new VmDefChanged(VmDefChanged.Type
196                    .valueOf(vmDefRef.type),
197                    channel
198                        .setGeneration(
199                            vmDefRef.object.getMetadata().getGeneration()),
200                    vmsCrd, vmDef), channel);
201            });
202        } catch (ApiException e) {
203            logger.log(Level.WARNING, e,
204                () -> "Change notificatin for unaccessible object.");
205        }
206    }
207
208    private void addDynamicData(K8sClient client, K8sDynamicModel vmState) {
209        var rootNode = GsonPtr.to(vmState.data()).get(JsonObject.class);
210        rootNode.addProperty("nodeName", "");
211
212        // VM definition status changes before the pod terminates.
213        // This results in pod information being shown for a stopped
214        // VM which is irritating. So check condition first.
215        var isRunning = GsonPtr.to(rootNode).to("status", "conditions")
216            .get(JsonArray.class)
217            .asList().stream().filter(el -> "Running"
218                .equals(((JsonObject) el).get("type").getAsString()))
219            .findFirst().map(el -> "True"
220                .equals(((JsonObject) el).get("status").getAsString()))
221            .orElse(false);
222        if (!isRunning) {
223            return;
224        }
225        var podSearch = new ListOptions();
226        podSearch.setLabelSelector("app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME
227            + ",app.kubernetes.io/component=" + APP_NAME
228            + ",app.kubernetes.io/instance=" + vmState.getMetadata().getName());
229        try {
230            var podList
231                = K8sV1PodStub.list(client, namespaceToWatch(), podSearch);
232            for (var podStub : podList) {
233                rootNode.addProperty("nodeName",
234                    podStub.model().get().getSpec().getNodeName());
235            }
236        } catch (ApiException e) {
237            logger.log(Level.WARNING, e,
238                () -> "Cannot access node information: " + e.getMessage());
239        }
240    }
241}
